intro: Psychotria comperei, commonly known as the Compère's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or greenish in color. It produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
